com.psddev.dari.util

Class Stats

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.psddev.dari.util.Stats

  • public class Stats
extends Object
    Gathers statistics about arbitrary operations.

    To use, first create an instance (usually as a static): 

     private static final Stats STATS = new Stats("Stats Name");

    Then wrap the code you want to measure with the timer methods: 

     Stats.Timer timer = STATS.startTimer();
 try {
     ...
 } finally {
     timer.stop("Operation Name");
 }

    Measurements will automatically be displayed through StatsDebugServlet, which is typically available at /_debug/stats.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Stats.Measurement
      Specific measurement of an operation within Stats.
      static class  Stats.Static
      Stats utility methods.
      class  Stats.Timer
      Timer for measuring the duration of an operation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Stats(String name)
      Creates an instance with the given name with 2 moving averages at 1 and 5 minute intervals.
      Stats(String name, double keepDuration, double measureInterval, double... averageIntervals)
      Creates an instance with the given name and moving averages with the given averageIntervals.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns how long the moving averages should be kept for.

      Returns how often the moving averages are measured.

      Returns the map of all measurements, including the total.

      Returns the name.
      Stats.Measurement getTotalMeasurement()
      Returns the total measurement.
